defaultValue: This is the area were you can enable / disable features.

fieldName: Generate additional lords on new game start
fieldDescription: If set to true, when starting a new game factions will create their own randomly generated lords, provided said faction does not already have any.
If set to true, lords can be permanently killable and new lords will enter the game as time goes on.

defaultValue: Configure whether hostile lords attack the player faction, and how aggressively.

fieldDescription: If set to true, the player's faction can be attacked by hostile lords.

fieldName: Allow attacks before any lords join
fieldDescription: If set to true, the player's faction can be attacked before any lords join the faction. Has no effect if 'Allow attacks on player faction' is false.

fieldName: Required reputation for directly opening communications from the lords tab
Required reputation for knowing a lord's location from the lords tab
Required reputation for knowing a lord's ships from the lords tab
Required reputation for knowing a lord's wealth from the lords tab
Required reputation for knowing a lord's current action from the lords tab
Show lords in the intel tab before you meet them
Show UI Message when lords are captured, released, or escape
fieldDescription: This setting is always true for lords of your own faction or faction you have a commission with.
Player faction only. Adds the setting value to the player's own council votes.

fieldName: Minimum stability to prevent fief defection
fieldDescription: Fief markets at or above this stability level will not defect. If stability drops below this value, the lord may defect and take the market with them.

fieldName: Maximum number of S-Mods a lord can have on each ship
If 'Progressive S-Mods' is installed, increase max number of S-Mods by 5
Allow additional lords for all factions
fieldDescription: Every faction will gain additional lords, regardless of whether they have any already.

Lords will not be generated past the maximum amount. Instead, the game will attempt to reduce every faction's generated lords so a number around the max amount is generated. Only affects randomly generated lords, and not the statically defined ones in json.

fieldName: The maximum number of lords that will be generated
fieldDescription: This will calculate each tier of lords individually, and then round down. This will only trigger if the calculated number of lords to generate is greater than this value.  This factors in statically defined lords.

defaultValue: This handles the number of lords generated based on total combined market size of a given faction.

fieldName: Tier 0 lords per total combined size
Tier 1 lords per total combined size
Tier 2 lords per total combined size

defaultValue: This handles the number of additional lords generated in each faction as a static amount on top of what is already calculated.
Odds of any given lord of a given tier having a fief at new game start. If many lords are selected for a fief, some may be unable to gain a fief regardless of how high these settings are.

fieldName: Odds of fief for tier 0 lords
Odds of fief for tier 1 lords
Odds of fief for tier 2 lords

defaultValue: Enable parts of the Life and Death system (if the system itself is enabled).

fieldDescription: If enabled, 'extremists' (such as pirates, or Luddic Path) will spawn instead of a faction lord if market stability is low enough.

defaultValue: Absolute limits for this system, lords cannot be generated or killed when past these values.
Control the spawn/death rates once lord counts moves outside the soft range, pushing it back into the soft range.

fieldDescription: Calculates speedup as a multiplier equal to 1 + (Speedup per lord under min * missing lords) to increase lord spawn rate.
Calculates slowdown as a multiplier equal to (Slowdown per lord over max ^ extra lords) to increase lord death chance.

defaultValue:
This controls the number of 'points' a market needs to accumulate to spawn a lord, as well as how quickly each market can generate points.
Each market holds its own store of 'points' it uses to generate lords. Points are gained every month.
The equation used is ((size * size mult) + (size exp ^ size)) * 1 - (missing stability * stability penalty).

fieldName: Odds of extremists per missing stability below par

defaultValue: The chance a lord will die if defeated in any given battle.
Ratio of a market having 'starting points' on new game, allowing variance of when lords start to spawn.

fieldDescription:
Controls how strongly the random multipler is pulled towards the target value. Higher weight results in less variance.
The equation results in the chance being 1/(weight^steps).

Controls how strongly the random multipler is pulled towards the target value. Higher weight results in less variance.
The equation results in the chance being 1/(weight^steps).

defaultValue: Odds of a given fleet generator being used on a lord's randomly generated fleet. Set to 0 to disable the generator.

fieldName: Odds of a given lord choosing their ships based of ship system
Odds of a given lord choosing their ships based on hullmods

Odds of a given lord choosing their ships completely randomly

defaultValue: Odds of a given flagship generator being used on a lord's randomly generated flagship. Set to 0 to disable the generator.

fieldName: Odds of a given lord choosing their flagship randomly
Odds of a given lord choosing their flagship based on its HP
Odds of a given lord choosing their flagship based on its cost

fieldDescription: The odds of a given lord being male. set to 0 for every lord to be female, set to 1 for every lord to be male

The substring that goes on the end of a given lords fleet name. All lord fleets start with their name and end with this value.
Example lord: Anderson Jackson, Example suffix: "'s fleet", Full fleet name: "Anderson Jackson's fleet"
The odds of any given lord using ships that are not prioritized by there faction
The odds of any given lord using a flagship that is not present in there fleet in any other way
